definition[0]: to officially judge how successful, effective, or valuable something is
example[0]: Greenpeace has been invited to appraise the environmental costs of such an operation.
definition[1]: to look carefully at someone or something to make an opinion about them
definition[2]: to decide how well an employee is doing his or her work, usually after discussing with the employee how well he or she has performed during the past year
example[2]: It is the line managerâ€™s job to appraise staff.
definition[3]: to decide how much something is worth after considering it carefully
example[3]: The property was appraised at $28 million.
